awd_titl_txt: Meeting on Nontraditional Methods for the Study of          Electrified Interfaces, Asilomar, CA, September, 1990
awd_abstract_narration: This project is in the general area of analytical and surface                   chemistry and in the subfield of interfacial electrochemistry.                  The SIXTH INTERNATIONAL MEETING ON NONTRADITIONAL METHODS FOR                   THE STUDY OF ELECTRIFIED INTERFACES will be held at Asilomar,                   California in September, 1990.  The purpose of this meeting is                  to bring together a group of scientists interested in                           interfacial science from both fundamental and applied                           viewpoints.  The meeting will focus on the following topics: 1)                 Theory of the structure of the electrochemical interface;                       2) Characterization of the interface (in situ and ex situ);                     3) Redox and interfacial electron transfer;  4) Colloids.                                                                                                       This conference focuses on physical aspects of electrochemistry                 and attracts investigators from other disciplines with                          nontraditional and stimulating approaches to the study of                       interfaces.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
